intro: Lespedeza monnoyeri, commonly known as the Chinese straggler bush, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest edges, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Lespedeza monnoyeri is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
